class.name: Word.Paragraph
class.description: Represents a single paragraph in a selection, range, content control, or document body.

properties.name: alignment
properties.description: Specifies the alignment for a paragraph. The value can be 'left', 'centered', 'right', or 'justified'.

examples.description: Center the alignment of the last paragraph in the document body.

properties.name: borders
properties.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set a red bottom border with 2pt width on the first paragraph in the document

properties.name: contentControls
properties.description: Gets the collection of content control objects in the paragraph.

examples.description: Find and highlight all content controls within the first paragraph of the document by setting their appearance to tags visible.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context to synchronize paragraph properties and log the paragraph's text content to the console

properties.name: endnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of endnotes in the paragraph.

examples.description: Count the number of endnotes in the first paragraph of the document and display the count in the console.

properties.name: fields
properties.description: Gets the collection of fields in the paragraph.

examples.description: Get all fields in the first paragraph of the document and display their types in the console.

properties.name: firstLineIndent
properties.description: Specifies the value, in points, for a first line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

examples.description: Set a first-line indent of 36 points for the first paragraph in the document

properties.name: font
properties.description: Gets the text format of the paragraph. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.

examples.description: Set the paragraph font to Calibri with size 14 and blue color

properties.name: footnotes
properties.description: Gets the collection of footnotes in the paragraph.

examples.description: Count and display the number of footnotes in the first paragraph of the document

properties.name: inlinePictures
properties.description: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the paragraph. The collection doesn't include floating images.

examples.description: Get all inline pictures from the first paragraph and set their width to 150 pixels

properties.name: isLastParagraph
properties.description: Indicates the paragraph is the last one inside its parent body.

examples.description: Add a page break after the current paragraph only if it's not the last paragraph in the document body.

properties.name: isListItem
properties.description: Checks whether the paragraph is a list item.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is a list item and display an alert with the result

properties.name: leftIndent
properties.description: Specifies the left indent value, in points, for the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the left indent of the first paragraph in the document to 75 points.

properties.name: lineSpacing
properties.description: Specifies the line spacing, in points, for the specified paragraph. In the Word UI, this value is divided by 12.

examples.description: Set the line spacing of the first paragraph in the document body to 20 points.

properties.name: lineUnitAfter
properties.description: Specifies the amount of spacing, in grid lines, after the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the spacing after the first paragraph in the document body to 1 line unit.

properties.name: lineUnitBefore
properties.description: Specifies the amount of spacing, in grid lines, before the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the spacing before the first paragraph in the document body to 1 line unit.

properties.name: list
properties.description: Gets the List to which this paragraph belongs. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph isn't in a list.

examples.description: Get the list level of the first paragraph in the document and display it to the user.

properties.name: listItem
properties.description: Gets the ListItem for the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph isn't part of a list.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is part of a list and get its level number, displaying an error message if it's not in a list.

properties.name: listItemOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the ListItem for the paragraph. If the paragraph isn't part of a list, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if the current paragraph is part of a list and display its list level if it is, otherwise display a message that it's not in a list.

properties.name: listOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the List to which this paragraph belongs. If the paragraph isn't in a list, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if the current paragraph is part of a list and display the list ID if it is, or show a message if it's not in a list.

properties.name: outlineLevel
properties.description: Specifies the outline level for the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the outline level of the first paragraph in the document to level 2 to organize it as a subheading in the document structure

properties.name: parentBody
properties.description: Gets the parent body of the paragraph.

examples.description: Get the parent body of a paragraph and highlight it with yellow background color to show the entire document body that contains the paragraph.

properties.name: parentContentControl
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is inside a content control and highlight the parent content control in yellow if it exists.

properties.name: parentContentControlOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the content control that contains the paragraph. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is inside a content control and highlight the content control in yellow if it exists

properties.name: parentTable
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is inside a table and highlight the entire table with a yellow background if it is.

properties.name: parentTableCell
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is inside a table cell and highlight the entire cell in yellow if it is.

properties.name: parentTableCellOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table cell that contains the paragraph. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if the current paragraph is inside a table cell, and if so, highlight the entire cell in yellow.

properties.name: parentTableOrNullObject
properties.description: Gets the table that contains the paragraph. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph is inside a table, and if so, apply a light blue shading to the entire table.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Highlight all text in the first paragraph by applying a yellow background color to its range

properties.name: rightIndent
properties.description: Specifies the right indent value, in points, for the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the right indent of the first paragraph in the document to 36 points (0.5 inches)

properties.name: shading
properties.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply a light gray background shading to the first paragraph in the document

properties.name: shapes
properties.description: Gets the collection of shape objects anchored in the paragraph, including both inline and floating shapes. Currently, only the following shapes are supported: text boxes, geometric shapes, groups, pictures, and canvases.

examples.description: Get all shapes anchored in the first paragraph and change the fill color of the first shape to blue

properties.name: spaceAfter
properties.description: Specifies the spacing, in points, after the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the spacing after the first paragraph in the document to 20 points.

properties.name: spaceBefore
properties.description: Specifies the spacing, in points, before the paragraph.

examples.description: Set the spacing before the first paragraph in the document to 24 points

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the style name for the paragraph. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the "styleBuiltIn" property.

examples.description: Apply a user-specified paragraph style to the first paragraph of the document body after validating the style exists and is of paragraph type.

properties.name: styleBuiltIn
properties.description: Specifies the built-in style name for the paragraph. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the "style" property.

examples.description: Create a structured document section with multiple paragraphs using built-in styles (Heading1, Heading2, Normal), including a highlighted content control placeholder for project costs and a page break at the end.

properties.name: tableNestingLevel
properties.description: Gets the level of the paragraph's table. It returns 0 if the paragraph isn't in a table.

examples.description: Check if the selected paragraph is in a table and display its nesting level, then highlight paragraphs that are in nested tables (level 2 or deeper)

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the paragraph.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text content of the first paragraph in the current selection.

properties.name: uniqueLocalId
properties.description: Gets a string that represents the paragraph identifier in the current session. ID is in standard 8-4-4-4-12 GUID format without curly braces and differs across sessions and coauthors.

examples.description: Register event handlers for paragraph changes and annotation interactions including clicks, hovers, insertions, removals, and popup actions in a Word document.
Log the event type, unique local ID, and text content of each paragraph that triggered a paragraph changed event.

methods.name: attachToList
methods.description: Lets the paragraph join an existing list at the specified level. Fails if the paragraph cannot join the list or if the paragraph is already a list item.

examples.description: Attach the first paragraph in the document to an existing numbered list at level 0

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Clears the contents of the paragraph object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.

examples.description: Clear the contents of the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: closeUp
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Remove spacing before a paragraph to close it up with the preceding content

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the paragraph and its content from the document.

examples.description: Delete the first paragraph from the document body.

methods.name: detachFromList
methods.description: Moves this paragraph out of its list, if the paragraph is a list item.

examples.description: Remove the first paragraph from its list while keeping the paragraph text in the document

methods.name: getAnnotations
methods.description: Gets annotations set on this Paragraph object.

examples.description: Read and display all annotations that have been set on the first paragraph in the document.

methods.name: getComments
methods.description: Gets comments associated with the paragraph.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all comments associated with the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: getContentControls
methods.description: Gets the currently supported content controls in the paragraph.

examples.description: Get all content controls within the first paragraph of the document and display their titles in the console.

methods.name: getHtml
methods.description: Gets an HTML representation of the paragraph object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use Paragraph.getOoxml() and convert the returned XML to HTML.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the HTML content of the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: getNext
methods.description: Gets the next paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph is the last one.

examples.description: Highlight the next paragraph after the first paragraph in the document by changing its font color to red.

methods.name: getNextOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the next paragraph. If the paragraph is the last one, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Check if a paragraph has a next paragraph and highlight it yellow if it exists, otherwise log that it's the last paragraph

methods.name: getOoxml
methods.description: Gets the Office Open XML (OOXML) representation of the paragraph object.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the OOXML (Office Open XML) markup of the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: getPrevious
methods.description: Gets the previous paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph is the first one.

examples.description: Get the previous paragraph from the current paragraph and highlight it in yellow

methods.name: getPreviousOrNullObject
methods.description: Gets the previous paragraph. If the paragraph is the first one, then this method returns an object with isNullObject = true. For further information, see “OrNullObject methods and properties”.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text of the second-to-last paragraph in the document, or indicate if no such paragraph exists.

methods.name: getRange
methods.description: Gets the whole paragraph, or the starting or ending point of the paragraph, as a range.

examples.description: Retrieve and display all complete sentences from the current insertion point to the end of the paragraph.

methods.name: getReviewedText
methods.description: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.

examples.description: Get and display the original text of the first paragraph before any tracked changes were made

methods.name: getText
methods.description: Returns the text of the paragraph. This excludes equations, graphics (e.g., images, videos, drawings), and special characters that mark various content (e.g., for content controls, fields, comments, footnotes, endnotes). By default, hidden text and text marked as deleted are excluded.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the text content from the first paragraph in the document body

methods.name: getTextRanges
methods.description: Gets the text ranges in the paragraph by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.

examples.description: Split a paragraph into individual sentences by detecting periods and question marks, then highlight each sentence with alternating colors.

methods.name: getTrackedChanges
methods.description: Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the paragraph.

examples.description: Get and display information about all tracked changes in the first paragraph of the document

methods.name: indent
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Indent the first paragraph in the document to create a visual hierarchy

methods.name: indentCharacterWidth
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Indent the first paragraph in the document by 10 character widths

methods.name: indentFirstLineCharacterWidth
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Indent the first line of the first paragraph in the document by 5 characters

methods.name: insertAnnotations
methods.description: Inserts annotations on this Paragraph object.

examples.description: Add multiple color-coded critique annotations with suggestions to specific character ranges within the selected paragraph.

methods.name: insertBreak
methods.description: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.

examples.description: Insert a page break after the first paragraph in the document body.
Insert a line break after the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: insertCanvas
methods.description: Inserts a floating canvas in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the paragraph.

examples.description: Insert a floating canvas with a rectangle shape at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: insertContentControl
methods.description: Wraps the Paragraph object with a content control.

examples.description: Wrap the first paragraph of the document body in a rich text content control.
Wrap each paragraph in the document with a content control and tag them alternately as "even" or "odd" based on their position.

methods.name: insertFileFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a document into the paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a document from a base64-encoded file at the end of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: insertGeometricShape
methods.description: Inserts a geometric shape in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the paragraph.

examples.description: Insert a blue rectangle shape at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: insertHtml
methods.description: Inserts HTML into the paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert HTML content containing bold text at the end of the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: insertInlinePictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a picture into the paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a base64-encoded inline picture at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document body.

methods.name: insertOoxml
methods.description: Inserts OOXML into the paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a formatted text block with bold styling into the current paragraph using OOXML
examples.usage_code:
await Word.run(async (context) => {
    // Get the first paragraph in the document
    const paragraph = context.document.body.paragraphs.getFirst();
    
    // OOXML string that defines a bold text run
    const ooxml = `
        <pkg:package xmlns:pkg="http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2006/xmlPackage">
            <pkg:part pkg:name="/_rels/.rels" pkg:contentType="application/vnd.openxmlformats-package.relationships+xml">
                <pkg:xmlData>
                    <Relationships xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/package/2006/relationships">
                        <Relationship Id="rId1" Type="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/officeDocument/2006/relationships/officeDocument" Target="word/document.xml"/>
                    </Relationships>
                </pkg:xmlData>
            </pkg:part>
            <pkg:part pkg:name="/word/document.xml" pkg:contentType="application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document.main+xml">
                <pkg:xmlData>
                    <w:document xmlns:w="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/wordprocessingml/2006/main">
                        <w:body>
                            <w:p>
                                <w:r>
                                    <w:rPr>
                                        <w:b/>
                                    </w:rPr>
                                    <w:t>This is bold text inserted via OOXML</w:t>
                                </w:r>
                            </w:p>
                        </w:body>
                    </w:document>
                </pkg:xmlData>
            </pkg:part>
        </pkg:package>`;
    
    // Insert the OOXML at the end of the paragraph
    paragraph.insertOoxml(ooxml, Word.InsertLocation.end);
    
    await context.sync();
});

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Insert a new paragraph with text after the currently selected paragraph

methods.name: insertPictureFromBase64
methods.description: Inserts a floating picture in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the paragraph.

examples.description: Insert a company logo as a floating picture at the beginning of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: insertTable
methods.description: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.

examples.description: Insert a 3x4 table after a paragraph and populate it with employee data including headers

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text into the paragraph at the specified location.

examples.description: Replace the last paragraph in the document with new text and format it with a black highlight and white font color.

methods.name: insertTextBox
methods.description: Inserts a floating text box in front of text with its anchor at the beginning of the paragraph.

examples.description: Insert a text box with placeholder text at the beginning of the first paragraph in the primary header section.

methods.name: joinList
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Remove a paragraph from its current list by joining it with the surrounding content

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the text content and style properties of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: next
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the paragraph that comes 2 positions after the first paragraph in the document and highlight it in yellow

methods.name: openOrCloseUp
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Toggle the spacing before a paragraph by opening or closing up the space for the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: openUp
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Add spacing before a paragraph by opening it up (increasing the space above it)

methods.name: outdent
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Decrease the indentation level of the first paragraph in the document by one level

methods.name: outlineDemote
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Demote the first paragraph in the document to a lower outline level (e.g., from Heading 1 to Heading 2)

methods.name: outlineDemoteToBody
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Demote the first paragraph in the document to body text level in the outline hierarchy

methods.name: outlinePromote
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Promote the first paragraph in the document to a higher outline level (e.g., from Heading 2 to Heading 1, or from body text to a heading)

methods.name: previous
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Get the previous 2 paragraphs before the currently selected paragraph and highlight them in yellow

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Reset a modified paragraph back to its original formatting and content state

methods.name: resetAdvanceTo
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Reset the "advance to" setting for the first paragraph in the document to its default state

methods.name: search
methods.description: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the paragraph object. The search results are a collection of range objects.

examples.description: Find and highlight all occurrences of the word "TODO" in the first paragraph of the document

methods.name: select
methods.description: Selects and navigates the Word UI to the paragraph.

examples.description: Select the last paragraph in the document body, either selecting the entire paragraph or positioning the cursor at its end.

methods.name: selectNumber
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Select the numbered list number/bullet of the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: separateList
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Separate the first paragraph from its list, converting it to a normal paragraph while keeping the remaining list items intact

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

examples.description: Set multiple properties of a paragraph including indentation and font formatting, and copy all properties from one paragraph to another.

methods.name: space1
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the spacing after a paragraph to single spacing (1.0) for the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: space1Pt5
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the line spacing of the first paragraph in the document to 1.5 lines

methods.name: space2
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Set the spacing after a paragraph to 12 points using the preview space2() method

methods.name: split
methods.description: Splits the paragraph into child ranges by using delimiters.

examples.description: Split the first paragraph into individual words and sequentially highlight each word in yellow with a brief pause between highlights, removing the previous word's highlight.

methods.name: startNewList
methods.description: Starts a new list with this paragraph. Fails if the paragraph is already a list item.

examples.description: Create a new list starting from the second paragraph in the document, add items at different list levels, and insert a paragraph after the list that is not part of it.

methods.name: tabHangingIndent
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Apply a hanging indent of 2 tab stops to the first paragraph in the document

methods.name: tabIndent
methods.description: Note: This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.

examples.description: Indent the first paragraph in the document by 3 tab stops to the right

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Paragraph object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ParagraphData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Load paragraph properties and serialize them to JSON for logging or external storage

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a paragraph object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls while modifying its properties in different batches

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Track a paragraph object to work with it across multiple sync() calls, then untrack it to free memory when done processing
